reviews.review_text:
This place is a perfect spot to indulge in authentic Goan cuisine. The flavors were spot on, and every dish we tried was cooked to perfection, truly capturing the essence of Goan flavors. The restaurant is well-maintained, clean, and provides a comfortable dining atmosphere. They offer a great selection of both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes, catering to diverse tastes.
One of the best aspects is the location—it's easy to find, making it convenient for both locals and tourists. The staff was incredibly polite, attentive, and ensured that everything was served exactly as requested, enhancing the overall dining experience.
Another highlight is their impressive range of alcoholic beverages, available at surprisingly reasonable prices. Unlike many high-end restaurants, the pricing here is quite budget-friendly, making it a great place to enjoy good food and drinks without breaking the bank.
The ambiance adds to the charm, with a cozy yet lively vibe, making it an ideal place for casual hangouts, family dinners, or even a night out with friends.
Overall, if you're looking for a place to enjoy delicious Goan cuisine, excellent service, and reasonably priced drinks in a pleasant setting, this spot is definitely worth a visit!

Too crowded place.
Fish thali is good, but fish curry is tasteless and no trace of fish in it.
Less staff and hence have to wait for longer time to give order.

Despite reaching at 10:45 PM, after the kitchen's closing time of 10:30 PM, the staff graciously accommodated us and served us amazing food. We tried the Chicken Crispy, Chicken Manchurian, chicken fried rice and Chicken Handi with Tandoor Naan—all were delicious, with perfect flavors and freshness. Exceptional service and great food make this place a must-visit!
